column4: Is it possible to update from Hardy to Intrepid using the Intrepid CD (regular, not alternate)?
Ok. I thought I could just add the CD as cdrom: in sources.list, but it just went ahead and downloaded everything instead, so I wondered why.
right, you need the alternate CD to be able to upgrade.
I've upgraded all the packages that had updates, but lsb_release still says Hardy
That link will walk you through the upgrade process.  You'll have to do it from the internet if you don't have an alternate CD
I'd already read this page. Does it make a difference that I upgraded with Upgrade Manager instead of Synaptic?
No, update-manager is the suggested method
Oh... "click on the "Updates" tab and change "Show new distribution release" to "Normal releases"" -- I don't think I did that
You don't manually change that stuff.
the only setting you have to change is the non-LTS releases in software sources.  Or wait for 10.04 to roll around.
You don't need to edit your sources at all to ugprade, update-managert does it for you.
oh, I know... I'm thinking for more technical things.
No, there's just two upgrade cycles.  Wehther you want to upgrade every few years, or every few months.
obviously though, older, more mature software is more stable.
I went to Intrepid because Hardy kept dropping me into busybox when I tried to boot
